powerful.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions
powerful.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
a very influential and powerful family
powerful.translation[0].definitions[1].d: having a strong effect on someone’s feelings or opinions
powerful.translation[0].definitions[1].n: powerful reasons/arguments (=reasons that make you think that something must be true)
powerful.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Good teamwork is a powerful tool (=very effective method) for effective management.
powerful.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a powerful feeling or effect is very strong or great
powerful.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Immigrants have had a powerful influence on the local culture.
powerful.translation[0].definitions[3].d: a powerful machine, engine, weapon etc is very effective and can do a lot
powerful.translation[0].definitions[3].e: a new generation of more powerful PCs
a machine that is immensely powerful
powerful.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Jed was a powerful, well-built man.
The females are smaller and less powerful than the males.
powerful.translation[0].definitions[5].d: a powerful blow, explosion etc has a lot of force
powerful.translation[0].definitions[5].e: an explosion ten times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb
a powerful right-foot shot on goal
winds powerful enough to uproot trees
powerful.translation[0].definitions[6].d: a powerful medicine or drug has a very strong effect on your body
powerful.translation[0].definitions[7].d: a powerful team, army etc is very strong and can easily defeat other teams or armies
powerful.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions
Parliament had become more powerful than the King.
having a lot of power to influence what happens, because people pay attention to what you say
He’s one of the most influential figures in international politics.
powerful – used about people or groups in politics who have a lot of supporters
The communists were particularly strong in the big industrial cities.
He is a strong voice in the state assembly.
more powerful than other people, groups, countries etc
She was the dominant force in women’s tennis for many years.
The company has a dominant position in the market.
